definition: Time that has passed will never come back. (idiom)
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

pinyin: ji1 bu4 ke3 shi1 , shi2 bu4 zai4 lai2

sentences.english: It's now or never, shall we chance it?
sentences.chinese: 机不可失，时不再来。咱们要不要碰碰运气？

pinyin: ji1 bu4 ke3 shi1 , shi2 bu4 zai4 lai2

definition: time and tide wait for no man (idiom)
to sit and waste a good opportunity (idiom); to lose the chance
to let sth slip by/to miss an opportunity
lit. An interval of time is worth an ounce of gold, money cannot buy you time. (idiom)/fig. Time is precious and must be treasured.
pinyin: yi1 cun4 guang1 yin1 yi1 cun4 jin1 , cun4 jin1 nan2 mai3 cun4 guang1 yin1
related.word: 一寸光阴一寸金，寸金难买寸光阴

definition: extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
if you are lazy in your prime, you'll be sorry in your old age
pinyin: shao4 zhuang4 bu4 nu3 li4 , lao3 da4 tu2 shang1 bei1
related.word: 少壮不努力，老大徒伤悲

definition: Time and tide wait for no man (idiom)
An ounce of gold can't buy you an interval of time (idiom); Money can't buy you time./Time is precious.
pinyin: cun4 jin1 nan2 mai3 cun4 guang1 yin1
